Package pieces

Class ChessPiece

  • java.lang.Object
    • pieces.ChessPiece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
    public abstract class ChessPiece
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class to fulfill role of different chess pieces.
    Author:
    Jonathan Wong, Shreyas Heragu

      • existsLegalMove

        public boolean existsLegalMove​(Board board)
        Checks if a legal move exists, by parsing through the entire board.
        Parameters:
        board - The chess board.
        Returns:
        True if a legal move exists, false otherwise.

      • checkMove

        public boolean checkMove​(int newRow,
                         int newCol,
                         Board board)
        Checks if input coordinate is a valid chess move. Accounts for checks by calling testDupMove.
        Parameters:
        newRow - The row of the new coordinate.
        newCol - The column of the new coordinate.
        board - The chess board.
        Returns:
        True if valid, false if not.

      • canAttack

        public abstract boolean canAttack​(int newRow,
                                  int newCol,
                                  Board board)
        Abstract method to check if a move to the new coordinate is valid. Doesn't account for checks.
        Parameters:
        newRow - The row of the new coordinate.
        newCol - The column of the new coordinate.
        board - The chess board.
        Returns:
        True if valid, false if not.

      • copy

        public abstract ChessPiece copy()
        Abstract method for a ChessPiece to return a copy of itself.
        Returns:
        A copied instance of the invoking ChessPiece.

      • isValidCastle

        public boolean isValidCastle​(int newRow,
                             int newCol,
                             Board board)
        Determines whether input move is a valid castle. Only overridden for Kings.
        Parameters:
        newRow - Row of destination coordinate.
        newCol - Column of destination coordinate.
        board - Relevant chess board.
        Returns:
        True if valid, false if not.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the String representation of the piece
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A String representing team and piece type.
